title: Afghanistan national cricket team

coverImage.altText: Image of Afghanistan national cricket team

summary: The Afghanistan national cricket team is the 12th Test cricket playing Full Member nation. Cricket has been played in Afghanistan since the mid 19th century, but it is only in recent years that the national team has become successful.

value.label: Afghanistan do not play their home matches in Afghanistan due to the ongoing security situation and the lack of international standard facilities.

image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 4.0 International license.

value.label: The earliest record of cricket in Afghanistan is of British troops playing a match in Kabul in 1839, though it appears that no long lasting legacy of cricket was left by the British.
The national team was invited to play in the second tier of Pakistani domestic cricket and the tour brought international media attention to Afghan cricket.
Afghanistan made their World Cup debut in the 50 over format of the game against Bangladesh at the Manuka Oval in Canberra, Australia.
In March 2019 against Ireland, Afghanistan achieved their first-ever test match victory in their only second test match, becoming only 3rd team after England and Pakistan to do so.

Mohammad Nabi is an Afghan cricketer who has captained the side in limited overs matches. He played a major role in Afghanistan's rise to the top level of international cricket, playing in both their first One Day International and their first Test match.
